verses.plain: My son, attend unto my wisdom, and bow thine ear to my understanding:

tokens.t: My son, attend unto my wisdom,
bow thine ear to my understanding:

verses.plain: That thou mayest regard discretion, and that thy lips may keep knowledge.

tokens.t: That thou mayest regard discretion, and
thy lips may keep knowledge.

verses.plain: ¶ For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil:

tokens.t: ¶ For the lips of a strange woman drop
an honeycomb, and her mouth
smoother than oil:

verses.plain: But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a twoedged sword.

tokens.t: But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a twoedged sword.

verses.plain: Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell.

tokens.t: Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell.

verses.plain: Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her ways are moveable, that thou canst not know them.

tokens.t: Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her ways are moveable,
thou canst not know

verses.plain: Hear me now therefore, O ye children, and depart not from the words of my mouth.

tokens.t: Hear me now therefore, O ye children, and depart not from the words of my mouth.

verses.plain: Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house:

tokens.t: Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house:

verses.plain: Lest thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel:

tokens.t: Lest thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel:

verses.plain: Lest strangers be filled with thy wealth; and thy labours be in the house of a stranger;

tokens.t: Lest strangers be filled with thy wealth; and thy labours
in the house of a stranger;

verses.plain: And thou mourn at the last, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,

tokens.t: And thou mourn at the last, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,

verses.plain: And say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;

tokens.t: And say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;

verses.plain: And have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!

tokens.t: And have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!

verses.plain: I was almost in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.

tokens.t: I was almost in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.

verses.plain: ¶ Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.

tokens.t: ¶ Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.

verses.plain: Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad, and rivers of waters in the streets.

tokens.t: Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad,
rivers of waters in the streets.

verses.plain: Let them be only thine own, and not strangers’ with thee.

tokens.t: Let them be only thine own, and not strangers’ with thee.

verses.plain: Let thy fountain be blessed: and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.

tokens.t: Let thy fountain be blessed: and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.

verses.plain: Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; and be thou ravished always with her love.

tokens.t: the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; and be thou ravished always with her love.

verses.plain: And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?

tokens.t: And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?

verses.plain: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD, and he pondereth all his goings.

tokens.t: For the ways of man
before the eyes of the
, and he pondereth all his goings.

verses.plain: ¶ His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sins.

tokens.t: ¶ His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sins.

verses.plain: He shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.

tokens.t: He shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.

footnotes.text: be thou…: Heb. err thou always in her love
